intro: Scelochilus larae, commonly known as the Lara's scelochilus, is a rare and little-known plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, delicate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Scelochilus larae is considered a species of conservation concern.
